sap.fe.macros.Chart.description:
Building block used to create a chart based on the metadata provided by OData V4.
Overview of Building Blocks
			

Usually, a contextPath and metaPath is expected.
Usage example:

<macros:Chart id="MyChart" contextPath="/RootEntity" metaPath="@com.sap.vocabularies.UI.v1.Chart" />

contextPath.description: Metadata path to the entitySet or navigationProperty

filterBar.description: Id of the FilterBar building block associated with the chart.

header.description: Specifies the header text that is shown in the chart

headerVisible.description: Controls if the header text should be shown or not

metaPath.description: Metadata path to the presentation context (UI.Chart with or without a qualifier)

personalization.description:
Controls which options should be enabled for the chart personalization dialog.
If it is set to `true`, all possible options for this kind of chart are enabled.
If it is set to `false`, personalization is disabled.

You can also provide a more granular control for the personalization by providing a comma-separated list with the options you want to be available.
Available options are:
- Sort
- Type
- Item
- Filter

selectionMode.description:
Defines the selection mode to be used by the chart.
Allowed values are `None`, `Single` or `Multiple`

variantManagement.description:
Controls the kind of variant management that should be enabled for the chart.
Allowed value is `Control`.
If set with value `Control`, a variant management control is seen within the chart and the chart is linked to this.
If not set with any value, variant management control is not available for this chart.

selectionChange.description: An event triggered when chart selections are changed. The event contains information about the data selected/deselected and the Boolean flag that indicates whether data is selected or deselected.

sap.fe.macros.CollectionBindingInfo.description: API to add parameters to the collection binding info.

sap.fe.macros.Field.description:
Building block for creating a field based on the metadata provided by OData V4.

Usually, a DataField or DataPoint annotation is expected, but the field can also be used to display a property from the entity type.
When creating a Field building block, you must provide an ID to ensure everything works correctly.
Usage example:

<macros:Field id="MyField" metaPath="MyProperty" />

Overview of Building Blocks

contextPath.description:
Defines the path of the context used in the current page or block.
This setting is defined by the framework.

description.description:
This is used to optionally provide an external description that comes from a different model than the oData model.
This should be used in conjunction with the value property.

metaPath.description: Defines the relative path of the property in the metamodel, based on the current contextPath.

readOnly.description:
An expression that allows you to control the read-only state of the field.
If you do not set any expression, SAP Fiori elements hooks into the standard lifecycle to determine the current state.

semanticObject.description:
Option to add semantic objects for a field.
This parameter overwrites the semantic objects defined through annotations.
Valid options are either a single semantic object, a stringified array of semantic objects,
a formatter or a single binding expression returning either a single semantic object or an array of semantic objects.

value.description:
This is used to optionally provide an external value that comes from a different model than the OData model.
It is designed to work with a field with value help, and without support for complex value help (currency / unit).

change.description: An event containing details is triggered when the value of the field is changed.

liveChange.description: An event containing details is triggered when the value of the field is live changed.

sap.fe.macros.form.FormElement.description: Building block used to create a form element based on the metadata provided by OData V4.

contextPath.description:
Defines the path of the context used in the current page or block.
This setting is defined by the framework.

label.description: Label shown for the field. If not set, the label from the annotations will be shown.

metaPath.description: Defines the relative path of the property in the metamodel, based on the current contextPath.

visible.description: If set to false, the FormElement is not rendered.

sap.fe.macros.KPITag.description: Building block used to create a KPI tag.

showIcon.description: Set it to `true` if the KPI should display its status icon.

unit.description: The Unit of Measure of the number to be displayed.

press.description: An event is triggered when the KPI is pressed.

sap.fe.macros.MacroAPI.description: Base API control for building blocks.

contextPath.description:
Defines the path of the context used in the current page or block.
This setting is defined by the framework.

metaPath.description: Defines the relative path of the property in the metamodel, based on the current contextPath.

sap.fe.macros.MessageButton.description:
Building block used to show bound messages.
The Message Button Building Block gets the bound messages from the MessageModel.
Usage example:

<macros:MessageButton visibilityChange=".handler.onMessageButtonVisibilityChange" />

visibilityChange.description: The event is triggered when the message button's visibility changes.

hideOnNoData.description: Show blank space in case there is no data in the chart

showOnlyChart.description:
To control the rendering of Title, Subtitle and Currency Labels. When the size is xs then we do
not see the inner labels of the MicroChart as well.

sap.fe.macros.MultiValueField.description:
Building block for creating a MultiValueField based on the metadata provided by OData V4.

The MultiValueField can be used to display either a DataField or Property directly. It has to point to a collection property.

Usage example:

<macro:MultiValueField
id="SomeUniqueIdentifier"
contextPath="{entitySet>}"
metaPath="{dataField>}"
/>

contextPath.description: The context path provided for the MultiValueField

items.description: Property added to be able to add data / items to the multi-input field using a different model

metaPath.description:
Defines the relative Metadata path to the MultiValueField.
The metaPath should point to a Property or DataField.

sap.fe.macros.Page.description:
Provides a Page building block that can be used to create a page with a title and content
By default, the page comes with an ObjectTitle

avatarSrc.description: Avatar source of the page. It is considered only if the title property is specified.

description.description: Description of the page. It is considered only if the title property is specified.

title.description:
Title of the page
If title is not given, then we will add a title, avatar and description based on the unqualified HeaderInfo associated to the entity

ariaTitle.description: Title of the object that is readout by screen readers when the next/previous item is loaded via keyboard focus on the paginator button.

sap.fe.macros.RichTextEditor.description:
Building block that exposes the RichTextEditor UI5 control.
It's used to enter formatted text, and uses the third-party component called TinyMCE.

excludeDefaultPlugins.description:
With the 'excludeDefaultPlugins' you can ask to remove the plugins that will be added by default
The default plugins are "emoticons" "directionality" "image" "table" "link" "powerpaste".

readOnly.description:
Use the readOnly attribute to override the edit flow of the page.
By setting 'readOnly' to true, a FormattedText will be displayed instead of the editor.

required.description: Use the 'required' attribute to make sure that the editor is filled with some text.

value.description: The value contained in the editor. You can use this attribute to set a default value.

sap.fe.macros.RichTextEditorWithMetadata.description:
Metadata-driven building block that exposes the RichTextEditor UI5 control.
It's used to enter formatted text and uses the third-party component called TinyMCE.

contextPath.description: The context path of the property displayed

metaPath.description: The metaPath of the displayed property

sap.fe.macros.Share.description:
Building block used to create the ‘Share’ functionality.

Please note that the 'Share in SAP Jam' option is only available on platforms that are integrated with SAP Jam.

If you are consuming this macro in an environment where the SAP Fiori launchpad is not available, then the 'Save as Tile' option is not visible.
Usage example:

<macros:Share
id="someID"
visible="true"
/>

Overview of Building Blocks

sap.fe.macros.VariantManagement.description:
Building block used to create a Variant Management based on the metadata provided by OData V4.
Usage example:

<macro:VariantManagement
id="SomeUniqueIdentifier"
for="{listOfControlIds>}"
/>

Overview of Building Blocks

headerLevel.description: Header level for the variant management, determining its position or style.

id.description: Identifier for the variant management control.

showSetAsDefault.description: Whether the "Set as Default" option is visible.

sap.fe.macros.chart.Action.description: Definition of a custom action to be used in the chart toolbar

anchor.description: Reference to the key of another action already displayed in the toolbar to properly place this one

placement.description:
Defines where this action should be placed relative to the defined anchor
Allowed values are `Before` and `After`

press.description: Event handler to be called when the user chooses the action

requiresSelection.description: Defines if the action requires a selection.

text.description: The text that will be displayed for this action
text.i18nClassification: BUT: Text of the action button

sap.fe.macros.chart.ActionGroup.description: Definition of a custom action group to be used inside the chart toolbar

anchor.description: Reference to the key of another action or action group already displayed in the toolbar to properly place this one

placement.description:
Defines where this action group should be placed relative to the defined anchor
Allowed values are `Before` and `After`

text.description: The text that will be displayed for this action group
text.i18nClassification: BUT: Text of the action group button

sap.fe.macros.chart.Chart.description:
Building block used to create a chart based on the metadata provided by OData V4.

Usually, a contextPath and metaPath is expected.
Usage example:

sap.ui.require(["sap/fe/macros/chart/Chart"], function(Chart) {
	 ...
	 new Chart("myChart", {metaPath:"MyChart"})
})

This is currently an experimental API because the structure of the generated content will change to come closer to the Chart that you get out of templates.
The public method and property will not change but the internal structure will so be careful on your usage.

contextPath.description: Metadata path to the entitySet or navigationProperty

filterBar.description: Id of the FilterBar building block associated with the chart.

header.description: Specifies the header text that is shown in the chart

headerVisible.description: Controls if the header text should be shown or not

metaPath.description: Metadata path to the presentation context (UI.Chart with or without a qualifier)

personalization.description:
Controls which options should be enabled for the chart personalization dialog.
If it is set to `true`, all possible options for this kind of chart are enabled.
If it is set to `false`, personalization is disabled.

You can also provide a more granular control for the personalization by providing a comma-separated list with the options you want to be available.
Available options are:
- Sort
- Type
- Item
- Filter

selectionMode.description:
Defines the selection mode to be used by the chart.
Allowed values are `None`, `Single` or `Multiple`

variantManagement.description:
Controls the kind of variant management that should be enabled for the chart.
Allowed value is `Control`.
If set with value `Control`, a variant management control is seen within the chart and the chart is linked to this.
If not set with any value, variant management control is not available for this chart.

selectionChange.description: An event triggered when chart selections are changed. The event contains information about the data selected/deselected and the Boolean flag that indicates whether data is selected or deselected.

sap.fe.macros.controls.BuildingBlockObje.description: Base class for building block complex object properties that can be serialized to XML.

sap.fe.macros.controls.BuildingBlockWith.description:
Using this class you can define a building block that will manage and render a templating based building block.
On change of the main properties you will be able to recreate the content.

sap.fe.macros.field.Field.description:
Building block for creating a field based on the metadata provided by OData V4.

Usually, a DataField or DataPoint annotation is expected, but the field can also be used to display a property from the entity type.
When creating a Field building block, you must provide an ID to ensure everything works correctly.
Usage example:

sap.ui.require(["sap/fe/macros/field/Field"], function(Field) {
	 ...
	 new Field("MyField", {metaPath:"MyProperty"})
})

This is currently an experimental API because the structure of the generated content will change to come closer to the Field that you get out of templates.
The public method and property will not change but the internal structure will so be careful on your usage.

contextPath.description:
Defines the path of the context used in the current page or block.
This setting is defined by the framework.

description.description:
This is used to optionally provide an external description that comes from a different model than the oData model.
This should be used in conjunction with the value property.

metaPath.description: Defines the relative path of the property in the metamodel, based on the current contextPath.

readOnly.description:
An expression that allows you to control the read-only state of the field.
If you do not set any expression, SAP Fiori elements hooks into the standard lifecycle to determine the current state.

semanticObject.description:
Option to add semantic objects for a field.
This parameter overwrites the semantic objects defined through annotations.
Valid options are either a single semantic object, a stringified array of semantic objects,
a formatter or a single binding expression returning either a single semantic object or an array of semantic objects.

value.description:
This is used to optionally provide an external value that comes from a different model than the OData model.
It is designed to work with a field with value help, and without support for complex value help (currency / unit).

change.description: An event containing details is triggered when the value of the field is changed.

liveChange.description: An event containing details is triggered when the value of the field is live changed.

sap.fe.macros.field.FieldFormatOptions.description: Additional format options for the field.

dateTimePattern.description:
Property for defining a custom pattern for the date, time, or dateTime format. 
If a dateTimePattern is defined, the dateTimeStyle is ignored.

dateTimeStyle.description:
Property for defining the display style for the date, time, or dateTime format. 
If there is a dateTimePattern defined, dateTimeStyle is ignored.

displayMode.description:
Defines how the field value and associated text will be displayed together.

Allowed values are "Value", "Description", "DescriptionValue" and "ValueDescription"

fieldEditStyle.description:
Determines how the field should be rendered, e.g. as radio buttons. 
If not all prerequisites are met, the field will default back to the standard rendering.

measureDisplayMode.description:
Defines if and how the field measure will be displayed.

Allowed values are "Hidden" and "ReadOnly"

radioButtonsHorizontalLayout.description: Specifies if radio buttons should be rendered in a horizontal layout.

reactiveAreaMode.description:
When the Field is displayed as a clickable element, it defines the size of the reactive area of the clickable element:
- ReactiveAreaMode.Inline - The link is displayed as part of a sentence.
- ReactiveAreaMode.Overlay - The link is displayed as an overlay on top of other interactive parts of the page.
Note: It is designed to make the clickable element easier to activate and helps meet the WCAG 2.2 Target Size requirement. It is applicable only for the SAP Horizon themes. Note: The size of the reactive area is sufficiently large to help users avoid accidentally selecting (clicking or tapping) unintended UI elements. UI elements positioned over other parts of the page may need an invisible active touch area. This ensures that no elements beneath are activated accidentally when the user tries to interact with the overlay element.

showDate.description:
Defines if the date part of a date time with timezone field should be shown. 

The dateTimeOffset field must have a timezone annotation.
The default value is true.

showTime.description:
Defines if the time part of a date time with timezone field should be shown. 

The dateTimeOffset field must have a timezone annotation.
The default value is true.

showTimezone.description:
Defines if the timezone part of a date time with timezone field should be shown. 

The dateTimeOffset field must have a timezone annotation.
The default value is true.

textExpandBehaviorDisplay.description:
Defines how the full text will be displayed.

Allowed values are "InPlace" and "Popover"

textLinesEdit.description: Maximum number of lines for multiline texts in edit mode.

textMaxCharactersDisplay.description: Maximum number of characters from the beginning of the text field that are shown initially.

textMaxLength.description:
Defines the maximum number of characters for the multiline text value.

If a multiline text exceeds the maximum number of allowed characters, the counter below the input field displays the exact number.

textMaxLines.description: Maximum number of lines that multiline texts in edit mode can grow to.

sap.fe.macros.filterBar.FilterBar.description:
Usage example:

sap.ui.require(["sap/fe/macros/filterBar/FilterBar"], function(FilterBar) {
	 ...
	 new FilterBar("MyFilterBar", {metaPath:"@com.sap.vocabularies.UI.v1.SelectionFields"})
})

This is currently an experimental API because the structure of the generated content will change to come closer to the FilterBar that you get out of templates.
The public method and property will not change but the internal structure will so be careful on your usage.

contextPath.description:
Defines the path of the context used in the current page or block.
This setting is defined by the framework.

liveMode.description: If true, the search is triggered automatically when a filter value is changed.

metaPath.description: Defines the relative path of the property in the metamodel, based on the current contextPath.

showClearButton.description: Handles the visibility of the 'Clear' button on the FilterBar.

showMessages.description: Displays possible errors during the search in a message box

visible.description: Parameter which sets the visibility of the FilterBar building block

afterClear.description: This event is fired when the 'Clear' button is pressed. This is only possible when the 'Clear' button is enabled.

filterChanged.description: This event is fired after either a filter value or the visibility of a filter item has been changed. The event contains conditions that will be used as filters.

search.description: This event is fired when the 'Go' button is pressed or after a condition change.

sap.fe.macros.FilterBar.description:
Building block for creating a FilterBar based on the metadata provided by OData V4.
Overview of Building Blocks
			

Usually, a SelectionFields annotation is expected.
Usage example:

<macros:FilterBar id="MyFilterBar" metaPath="@com.sap.vocabularies.UI.v1.SelectionFields" />

contextPath.description:
Defines the path of the context used in the current page or block.
This setting is defined by the framework.

liveMode.description: If true, the search is triggered automatically when a filter value is changed.

metaPath.description: Defines the relative path of the property in the metamodel, based on the current contextPath.

showClearButton.description: Handles the visibility of the 'Clear' button on the FilterBar.

showMessages.description: Displays possible errors during the search in a message box

visible.description: Parameter which sets the visibility of the FilterBar building block

afterClear.description: This event is fired when the 'Clear' button is pressed. This is only possible when the 'Clear' button is enabled.

filterChanged.description: This event is fired after either a filter value or the visibility of a filter item has been changed. The event contains conditions that will be used as filters.

search.description: This event is fired when the 'Go' button is pressed or after a condition change.

sap.fe.macros.filterBar.FilterField.description:
Definition of a custom filter to be used inside the FilterBar.
The template for the FilterField has to be provided as the default aggregation
Overview of Building Blocks

anchor.description: Reference to the key of another filter already displayed in the table to properly place this one

key.description: The property name of the FilterField

label.description: The text that will be displayed for this FilterField

placement.description:
Defines where this filter should be placed relative to the defined anchor
Allowed values are `Before` and `After`

property.description:
Defines which property will be influenced by the FilterField.
This must be a valid property of the entity as this can be used for SAP Companion integration

required.description: If set, the FilterField will be marked as a mandatory field.

showMessages.description: This property is not required at filter field level. To achieve the desired behavior, specify the showMessages property in the FilterBar building block.

sap.fe.macros.Form.description:
Building block for creating a Form based on the metadata provided by OData V4.

It is designed to work based on a FieldGroup annotation but can also work if you provide a ReferenceFacet or a CollectionFacet
Usage example:

<macros:Form id="MyForm" metaPath="@com.sap.vocabularies.UI.v1.FieldGroup#GeneralInformation" />

title.description: The title of the form control.

sap.fe.macros.microchart.MicroChart.description:
Building block used to create a MicroChart based on the metadata provided by OData V4.

Usually, a contextPath and metaPath is expected.
Usage example:

sap.ui.require(["sap/fe/macros/microchart/MicroChart"], function(MicroChart) {
	 ...
	 new MicroChart("microChartID", {metaPath:"MyProperty"})
})

This is currently an experimental API because the structure of the generated content will change to come closer to the MicroChart that you get out of templates.
The public method and property will not change but the internal structure will so be careful on your usage.

hideOnNoData.description: Show blank space in case there is no data in the chart

showOnlyChart.description:
To control the rendering of Title, Subtitle and Currency Labels. When the size is xs then we do
not see the inner labels of the MicroChart as well.

buttons.description: The buttons to be displayed in the group.

customToolbarPriority.description: The priority of the group in the custom toolbar.

row.description: Row number in which the button should be

sap.fe.macros.richtexteditor.Plugin.description:
Represents a TinyMCE plugin.
Each object has to contain a property "name" which then contains the plugin name/ID.

sap.fe.macros.table.Action.description: Definition of a custom action to be used inside the table toolbar

anchor.description: Reference to the key of another action already displayed in the toolbar to properly place this one

command.description: Determines the shortcut combination to trigger the action

enableOnSelect.description:
Determines whether the action requires selecting one item or multiple items.
Allowed values are `single` and `multi`

isAIOperation.description: Displays the AI Icon on the action button.

placement.description:
Defines where this action should be placed relative to the defined anchor
Allowed values are `Before` and `After`

requiresSelection.description: Defines if the action requires a selection.

text.description: The text that will be displayed for this action
text.i18nClassification: BUT: Text of the action button

visible.description: Determines whether the action is visible.

press.description: Event handler to be called when the user chooses the action

sap.fe.macros.table.ActionGroup.description: Definition of a custom ActionGroup to be used inside the table toolbar

anchor.description: Reference to the key of another action or action group already displayed in the toolbar to properly place this one

defaultAction.description: Determines the default action to be executed on the action group.

placement.description:
Determines where this action group should be placed relative to the defined anchor
Allowed values are `Before` and `After`

text.description: The text that will be displayed for this action group
text.i18nClassification: BUT: Text of the action group button

sap.fe.macros.table.ActionGroupOverride.description: Definition of an action group override to be used inside the Table building block.

anchor.description: Reference to the key of another action or action group already displayed in the toolbar to properly place this one

key.description: Unique identifier of the ActionGroup to overridden.

placement.description:
Determines where this action group should be placed relative to the defined anchor
Allowed values are `Before` and `After`

sap.fe.macros.table.ActionOverride.description: Definition of an override for the action to be used inside the Table building block.

anchor.description: Reference to the key of another action already displayed in the toolbar to properly place this one

command.description: Determines the shortcut combination to trigger the action

defaultValuesFunction.description: Determines the function to get the default values of the action.

enableAutoScroll.description: Determines if the auto scroll is enabled after executing the action.

enableOnSelect.description:
Determines whether the action requires selecting one item or multiple items.
Allowed values are `single` and `multi`

isAIOperation.description: Displays the AI Icon on the action button.

key.description: Unique identifier of the action to overridden.

navigateToInstance.description: Determines whether there is a navigation after executing the action.

placement.description:
Defines where this action should be placed relative to the defined anchor
Allowed values are `Before` and `After`

visible.description: Determines whether the action is visible.

sap.fe.macros.table.AnalyticalConfigurat.description: A set of options that can be configured to control the aggregation behavior

aggregationOnLeafLevel.description: True if leaf level rows shall display aggregated data

sap.fe.macros.table.Column.description:
Definition of a custom column to be used inside the table.
The template for the column has to be provided as the default aggregation

anchor.description: Reference to the key of another column already displayed in the table to properly place this one

availability.description:
The column availability
Allowed values are `Default`, `Adaptation`, `Hidden`

header.description: The text that will be displayed for this column header

horizontalAlign.description: Aligns the header as well as the content horizontally

importance.description:
Defines the column importance.
You can define which columns should be automatically moved to the pop-in area based on their importance

placement.description:
Determines where this column should be placed relative to the defined anchor
Allowed values are `Before` and `After`

required.description: Determines if the information in the column is required.

tooltip.description: Determines the text displayed for the column tooltip

width.description:
Determines the column's width.
Allowed values are 'auto', 'value', and 'inherit', according to sap.ui.core.CSSSize

widthIncludingColumnHeader.description: Indicates if the column header should be a part of the width calculation.

sap.fe.macros.table.ColumnExportSettings.description: Definition of the export settings applied to a column within the table.

template.description: Determines a formatting template that supports indexed placeholders within curly brackets.

type.description: Determines the data type of the field

width.description: Determines the width of the column in characters

wrap.description: Determines if the content needs to be wrapped.

sap.fe.macros.table.ColumnOverride.description: Definition of an override for the column to be used inside the Table building block.

availability.description:
The column availability
Allowed values are `Default`, `Adaptation`, `Hidden``

horizontalAlign.description: Aligns the header as well as the content horizontally

importance.description:
Defines the importance of the column.
You can define which columns should be automatically moved to the pop-in area based on their importance

key.description: Unique identifier of the column to overridden.

width.description:
Determines the column's width.
Allowed values are 'auto', 'value', and 'inherit', according to sap.ui.core.CSSSize

widthIncludingColumnHeader.description: Indicates if the column header should be a part of the width calculation.

sap.fe.macros.table.MassEdit.description: Definition of the mass edit to be used inside the table.

operationGroupingMode.description:
Defines the mode of the operation grouping to save the new values
Allowed values are `ChangeSet` and `Isolated`

sap.fe.macros.table.QuickVariantSelectio.description: Definition of the quickVariantSelection to be used inside the table.

showCounts.description: Defines whether the counts should be displayed next to the text

sap.fe.macros.Table.description:
Building block used to create a table based on the metadata provided by OData V4.

Usually, a LineItem, PresentationVariant, or SelectionPresentationVariant annotation is expected, but the Table building block can also be used to display an EntitySet.

If a PresentationVariant is specified, then it must have UI.LineItem as the first property of the Visualizations.

If a SelectionPresentationVariant is specified, then it must contain a valid PresentationVariant that also has a UI.LineItem as the first property of the Visualizations.
Usage example:

<macros:Table id="MyTable" metaPath="@com.sap.vocabularies.UI.v1.LineItem" />

Overview of Table Building Blocks

busy.description: An expression that allows you to control the 'busy' state of the table.

condensedTableLayout.description: Determines whether the table adapts to the condensed layout.

contextPath.description:
Defines the path of the context used in the current page or block.
This setting is defined by the framework.

disableColumnFreeze.description:
Determines whether the number of fixed columns can be configured in the Column Settings dialog.
This property doesn't apply for responsive tables

disableCopyToClipboard.description: Controls if the copy functionality of the table is disabled or not.

enableAutoColumnWidth.description: Specifies if the column width is automatically calculated.

enableExport.description: Controls if the export functionality of the table is enabled or not.

enableFullScreen.description: Controls whether the table can be opened in fullscreen mode or not.

enablePaste.description: Controls if the paste functionality of the table is enabled or not.

enablePastingOfComputedProperties.description: Determine whether the data copied to the computed columns is sent to the back end.

enableSelectAll.description:
Determines whether the Clear All button is enabled by default.
To enable the Clear All button by default, you must set this property to false.

exportRequestSize.description: Maximum allowed number of records to be exported in one request.

filterBar.description: ID of the FilterBar building block associated with the table.

frozenColumnCount.description:
Number of columns that are fixed on the left. Only columns which are not fixed can be scrolled horizontally.
This property is not relevant for responsive tables

header.description: Specifies the header text that is shown in the table.

headerVisible.description: Controls if the header text should be shown or not.

ignoredFields.description:
Comma-separated value of fields that must be ignored in the OData metadata by the Table building block.
The table building block is not going to create built-in columns or offer table personalization for comma-separated value of fields that are provided in the ignoredfields.
Any column referencing an ignored field is to be removed.

isSearchable.description: Defines whether to display the search action.

metaPath.description: Defines the relative path to a LineItem, PresentationVariant or SelectionPresentationVariant in the metamodel, based on the current contextPath.

modeForNoDataMessage.description:
Changes the size of the IllustratedMessage in the table, or removes it completely.
Allowed values are `illustratedMessage-Auto`, `illustratedMessage-Base`, `illustratedMessage-Dialog`, `illustratedMessage-Dot`, `illustratedMessage-Scene`, `illustratedMessage-Spot` or `text`.

personalization.description:
Controls which options should be enabled for the table personalization dialog.
If it is set to `true`, all possible options for this kind of table are enabled.
If it is set to `false`, personalization is disabled.

You can also provide a more granular control for the personalization by providing a comma-separated list with the options you want to be available.
Available options are:
- Sort
- Column
- Filter
- Group

The Group option is only applicable to analytical tables and responsive tables.

popinLayout.description:
Defines the layout options of the table popins. Only applies to responsive tables.
Allowed values are `Block`, `GridLarge`, and `GridSmall`.
- `Block`: Sets a block layout for rendering the table popins. The elements inside the popin container are rendered one below the other.
- `GridLarge`: Sets a grid layout for rendering the table popins. The grid width for each table popin is comparatively larger than GridSmall, so this layout allows less content to be rendered in a single popin row.
- `GridSmall`: Sets a grid layout for rendering the table popins. The grid width for each table popin is small, so this layout allows more content to be rendered in a single popin row.

readOnly.description:
An expression that allows you to control the 'read-only' state of the table.
If you do not set any expression, SAP Fiori elements hooks into the standard lifecycle to determine the current state.

rowCount.description: Number of rows to be displayed in the table. Does not apply to responsive tables.

rowCountMode.description:
Defines how the table handles the visible rows. Does not apply to Responsive tables.
Allowed values are `Auto`, `Fixed`, and `Interactive`.
- If set to `Fixed`, the table always has as many rows as defined in the rowCount property.
- If set to `Auto`, the number of rows is changed by the table automatically. It will then adjust its row count to the space it is allowed to cover (limited by the surrounding container) but it cannot have less than defined in the `rowCount` property.
- If set to `Interactive` the table can have as many rows as defined in the rowCount property. This number of rows can be modified by dragging the resizer available in this mode.

scrollThreshold.description: Defines how many additional data records are requested from the back-end system when the user scrolls vertically in the table.

selectionLimit.description:
Defines the maximum number of rows that can be selected at once in the table.
This property does not apply to responsive tables.

selectionMode.description:
Defines the selection mode to be used by the table.
Allowed values are `None`, `Single`, `ForceSingle`, `Multi`, `ForceMulti` or `Auto`.
If set to 'Single', 'Multi' or 'Auto', SAP Fiori elements hooks into the standard lifecycle to determine the consistent selection mode.
If set to 'ForceSingle' or 'ForceMulti' your choice will be respected but this might not respect the Fiori guidelines.

threshold.description: Defines the number of records to be initially requested from the back end.

type.description:
Defines the type of table that will be used by the building block to render the data.
Allowed values are `GridTable`, `ResponsiveTable` and `AnalyticalTable`.

variantManagement.description:
Controls the kind of variant management that should be enabled for the table.
Allowed value is `Control`.
If set with value `Control`, a variant management control is seen within the table and the table is linked to this.
If not set with any value, control level variant management is not available for this table.

widthIncludingColumnHeader.description: Indicates if the column header should be a part of the width calculation.

beforeRebindTable.description:
Before a table rebind, an event is triggered that contains information about the binding.
The event contains a parameter, `collectionBindingInfo`, which is an instance of `CollectionBindingInfoAPI`.
This allows you to manipulate the table's list binding.
You can use this event to attach event handlers to the table's list binding.
You can use this event to add selects, and add or read the sorters and filters.

rowPress.description:
An event is triggered when the user chooses a row; the event contains information about which row is chosen.
You can set this in order to handle the navigation manually.

selectionChange.description: An event triggered when the selection in the table changes.

sap.fe.macros.table.Table.description:
Building block used to create a table based on the metadata provided by OData V4.

Usually, a LineItem, PresentationVariant or SelectionPresentationVariant annotation is expected, but the Table building block can also be used to display an EntitySet.

If a PresentationVariant is specified, then it must have UI.LineItem as the first property of the Visualizations.

If a SelectionPresentationVariant is specified, then it must contain a valid PresentationVariant that also has a UI.LineItem as the first property of the Visualizations.
Usage example:

sap.ui.require(["sap/fe/macros/table/Table"], function(Table) {
	 ...
	 new Table("myTable", {metaPath:"@com.sap.vocabularies.UI.v1.LineItem"})
})

This is currently an experimental API because the structure of the generated content will change to come closer to the Table that you get out of templates.
The public method and property will not change but the internal structure will so be careful on your usage.

busy.description: An expression that allows you to control the 'busy' state of the table.

condensedTableLayout.description: Determines whether the table adapts to the condensed layout.

contextPath.description:
Defines the path of the context used in the current page or block.
This setting is defined by the framework.

disableColumnFreeze.description:
Determines whether the number of fixed columns can be configured in the Column Settings dialog.
This property doesn't apply for responsive tables

disableCopyToClipboard.description: Controls if the copy functionality of the table is disabled or not.

enableAutoColumnWidth.description: Specifies if the column width is automatically calculated.

enableExport.description: Controls if the export functionality of the table is enabled or not.

enableFullScreen.description: Controls whether the table can be opened in fullscreen mode or not.

enablePaste.description: Controls if the paste functionality of the table is enabled or not.

enablePastingOfComputedProperties.description: Determine whether the data copied to the computed columns is sent to the back end.

enableSelectAll.description:
Determines whether the Clear All button is enabled by default.
To enable the Clear All button by default, you must set this property to false.

exportRequestSize.description: Maximum allowed number of records to be exported in one request.

filterBar.description: ID of the FilterBar building block associated with the table.

frozenColumnCount.description:
Number of columns that are fixed on the left. Only columns which are not fixed can be scrolled horizontally.
This property is not relevant for responsive tables

header.description: Specifies the header text that is shown in the table.

headerVisible.description: Controls if the header text should be shown or not.

ignoredFields.description:
Comma-separated value of fields that must be ignored in the OData metadata by the Table building block.
The table building block is not going to create built-in columns or offer table personalization for comma-separated value of fields that are provided in the ignoredfields.
Any column referencing an ignored field is to be removed.

isSearchable.description: Defines whether to display the search action.

metaPath.description: Defines the relative path to a LineItem, PresentationVariant or SelectionPresentationVariant in the metamodel, based on the current contextPath.

modeForNoDataMessage.description:
Changes the size of the IllustratedMessage in the table, or removes it completely.
Allowed values are `illustratedMessage-Auto`, `illustratedMessage-Base`, `illustratedMessage-Dialog`, `illustratedMessage-Dot`, `illustratedMessage-Scene`, `illustratedMessage-Spot` or `text`.

personalization.description:
Controls which options should be enabled for the table personalization dialog.
If it is set to `true`, all possible options for this kind of table are enabled.
If it is set to `false`, personalization is disabled.

You can also provide a more granular control for the personalization by providing a comma-separated list with the options you want to be available.
Available options are:
- Sort
- Column
- Filter
- Group

The Group option is only applicable to analytical tables and responsive tables.

popinLayout.description:
Defines the layout options of the table popins. Only applies to responsive tables.
Allowed values are `Block`, `GridLarge`, and `GridSmall`.
- `Block`: Sets a block layout for rendering the table popins. The elements inside the popin container are rendered one below the other.
- `GridLarge`: Sets a grid layout for rendering the table popins. The grid width for each table popin is comparatively larger than GridSmall, so this layout allows less content to be rendered in a single popin row.
- `GridSmall`: Sets a grid layout for rendering the table popins. The grid width for each table popin is small, so this layout allows more content to be rendered in a single popin row.

readOnly.description:
An expression that allows you to control the 'read-only' state of the table.
If you do not set any expression, SAP Fiori elements hooks into the standard lifecycle to determine the current state.

rowCount.description: Number of rows to be displayed in the table. Does not apply to responsive tables.

rowCountMode.description:
Defines how the table handles the visible rows. Does not apply to Responsive tables.
Allowed values are `Auto`, `Fixed`, and `Interactive`.
- If set to `Fixed`, the table always has as many rows as defined in the rowCount property.
- If set to `Auto`, the number of rows is changed by the table automatically. It will then adjust its row count to the space it is allowed to cover (limited by the surrounding container) but it cannot have less than defined in the `rowCount` property.
- If set to `Interactive` the table can have as many rows as defined in the rowCount property. This number of rows can be modified by dragging the resizer available in this mode.

scrollThreshold.description: Defines how many additional data records are requested from the back-end system when the user scrolls vertically in the table.

selectionLimit.description:
Defines the maximum number of rows that can be selected at once in the table.
This property does not apply to responsive tables.

selectionMode.description:
Defines the selection mode to be used by the table.
Allowed values are `None`, `Single`, `ForceSingle`, `Multi`, `ForceMulti` or `Auto`.
If set to 'Single', 'Multi' or 'Auto', SAP Fiori elements hooks into the standard lifecycle to determine the consistent selection mode.
If set to 'ForceSingle' or 'ForceMulti' your choice will be respected but this might not respect the Fiori guidelines.

threshold.description: Defines the number of records to be initially requested from the back end.

type.description:
Defines the type of table that will be used by the building block to render the data.
Allowed values are `GridTable`, `ResponsiveTable` and `AnalyticalTable`.

variantManagement.description:
Controls the kind of variant management that should be enabled for the table.
Allowed value is `Control`.
If set with value `Control`, a variant management control is seen within the table and the table is linked to this.
If not set with any value, control level variant management is not available for this table.

widthIncludingColumnHeader.description: Indicates if the column header should be a part of the width calculation.

beforeRebindTable.description:
Before a table rebind, an event is triggered that contains information about the binding.
The event contains a parameter, `collectionBindingInfo`, which is an instance of `CollectionBindingInfoAPI`.
This allows you to manipulate the table's list binding.
You can use this event to attach event handlers to the table's list binding.
You can use this event to add selects, and add or read the sorters and filters.

rowPress.description:
An event is triggered when the user chooses a row; the event contains information about which row is chosen.
You can set this in order to handle the navigation manually.

selectionChange.description: An event triggered when the selection in the table changes.

createAtEnd.description:
Specifies if the new entry should be created at the top or bottom of a table in case of creationMode 'Inline'
The default value is 'false'

creationFields.description:
Defines the list of properties that will be displayed in the creation dialog, when the creation mode is set to 'CreationDialog'.
The value is a comma-separated list of property names.

inlineCreationRowsHiddenInEditMode.description:
Specifies if the new entry should be hidden in case of creationMode 'InlineCreationRows'. This only applies to responsive tables.
The default value is 'false'

name.description:
Defines the creation mode to be used by the table.
Allowed values are `NewPage`, `Inline`, `InlineCreationsRows`, `External` or `CreationDialog`.

NewPage - the created document is shown in a new page, depending on whether metadata 'Sync', 'Async' or 'Deferred' is used
Inline - The creation is done inline
InlineCreationsRows - The creation is done inline with an empty row
External - The creation is done in a different application specified via the parameter 'outbound'
CreationDialog - the creation is done in the table, with a dialog allowing to specify some initial property values (the properties are listed in `creationFields`).

If not set with any value:
if navigation is defined, the default value is 'NewPage'. Otherwise it is 'Inline'.

outbound.description: The navigation target where the document is created in case of creationMode 'External'

Building block used to create a tree table based on the metadata provided by OData V4.

sap.fe.macros.table.TreeTableCreationOpt.description: Create options for the tree table.

createInPlace.description:
Specifies if the new entry should be placed at the position computed by the backend (e.g. taking sorting into account).
The default value is 'false' (that is, the new entry is placed as the first child below its parent).

creationFields.description:
Defines the list of properties that will be displayed in the creation dialog, when the creation mode is set to 'CreationDialog'.
The value is a comma-separated list of property names.

isCreateEnabled.description: Defines the extension point to control the enablement of the Create button or Create Menu buttons.

name.description:
Defines the creation mode to be used by the tree table.
Allowed values are `NewPage`, `Inline` or `CreationDialog`.

NewPage - the created document is shown in a new page, depending on whether metadata 'Sync', 'Async' or 'Deferred' is used.
Inline - the creation is done inline.
CreationDialog - the creation is done in the table, with a dialog allowing to specify some initial property values (the properties are listed in `creationFields`).

If not set with any value:
if navigation is defined, the default value is 'NewPage'. Otherwise it is 'Inline'.

nodeType.description:
Defines the nodes to be added on the custom create.
This object must have the following properties:
propertyName: the name of the property on the page entity set used to categorize the node type to be created within the hierarchy
values: an array of key, label and an optional creationFields that define a value of the property defined by the propertyName key, its label, and the specific fields to be shown in the creation dialog.

sap.fe.macros.ActionGroup.description: Definition of a actions group to be used inside the table toolbar

text.description: The text that will be displayed for this action group
text.i18nClassification: BUT: Text of the action group button

placement.description: Defines where this action group should be placed relative to the defined anchor

anchor.description: Reference to the key of another action or action group already displayed in the toolbar to properly place this one

sap.fe.macros.controls.section.ISingleSe.description: Definition of data consumer by section from single control

title.description: Defines the title to be used by the single control.

sap.fe.macros.controls.section.ISingleSe.description: Definition of data provided by section to single control

title.description: Defines the title to be used by the section.
